intro: Weberbauera parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved Weberbauera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
